special_notes: "The Current History Magazine was issued in October and November during the Printers' strike in New York under extraordinary conditions. Our magazine plant was closed down, but rather than miss an issue we put the magazine through the rotogravure department of the New York Times. The physical make up suffered severely by the quick change and the date of issue was delayed nearly three weeks so that instead of being on sale on October 1, 1919, it was not ready for stands until after October 15, 1919. Being a news magazine naturally this seriously diminshed the sales and as is apparent, reduced our circulation that month by nearly 10,000."

"The Current History Magazine was issued in October and November during the Printers' strike in New York under extraordinary conditions. Our magazine plant was closed down, but rather than miss an issue we put the magazine through the rotogravure department of the New York Times. The physical make up suffered severely by the quick change and the date of issue was delayed nearly three weeks so that instead of being on sale on October 1, 1919, it was not ready for stands until after October 15, 1919. Being a news magazine naturally this seriously diminshed the sales and as is apparent, reduced our circulation that month by nearly 10,000."

"With July, 1940 issue, Forum and Century was consolidated with Current History and the new pulcication will be called Current History and Forum. There were 29,832 subscriptsions taken over and these were entered on basis that subscription price of Forum andn Century bore to subscritpion price of Current History."
